A picture of the same was shared on Twitter and Reddit. "Can't believe this is real," said one user, while another said, "This is so stupid, it made me laugh."

349.title: Malvika enters 2nd round, Prannoy loses at Korea Open 2022
349.article_body: Indian shuttler HS Prannoy lost in first round of men's singles event at 2022 Korea Open Super 500 badminton tournament on Tuesday. The world number 23 lost to 71st-ranked Cheam June Wei of Malaysia 17-21, 7-21 in 41 minutes. Earlier, unseeded Indian Malvika Bansod entered second round of women's singles after defeating world number 24 Han Yue 20-22, 22-20, 21-10.

350.title: Diesel leaks from pipeline during theft & causes fire on Thane road
350.article_body: Diesel leaked from a pipeline when a few people allegedly tried to steal it on Tuesday morning in Thane. The leak caused a fire on the Shil-Mahape road but no casualties were reported. The accused allegedly stole diesel from a pipeline of BPCL passing from Mumbai refinery to Delhi, said an official from Thane Municipal Corporation.

351.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused isn't mentally unstable: Doctors
351.article_body: JSP Singh, Superintendent-in-Chief of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose District Hospital, has claimed that Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple, isn't mentally unstable. "The accused...was talking coherently, was responding to the queries of doctors and the police and didn't display...violent behaviour," he added. His father had said he suffers from depression.

352.title: Elon Musk to join Twitter's board of directors
352.article_body: Twitter is appointing the world's richest person Elon Musk to its board of directors after he disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in the company. "He's both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on Twitter, and in the boardroom," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

353.title: EVs in Delhi can be charged for free in the noon at 35 spots from June 1
353.article_body: EV owners in Delhi will be able to charge their vehicles for free between 12:00 pm and 3:00 pm from June 1 onwards, ElectriVa Founder Sumit Dhanuka said. The facility will be provided to commercial and non-commercial EVs at around 35 charging stations operational along the Ring Road. "We want to bolster Delhi's EV ecosystem," Dhanuka added.

354.title: Model from Brazil faces divorce from 1 of his 9 wives, says 'I wish to have 10 wives'
354.article_body: Arthur O Urso, a male model from Brazil who went viral after his marriage to nine different women is now facing divorce from one of his wives. He said she wants a divorce because she was "missing a monogamous relationship". However, he added that he plans to marry more women as "his wish has always been to have 10 wives".

355.title: Says a lot about toxic masculinity: Schumer on Will slapping Chris
355.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said actor Will Smith slapping presenter Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 was "really upsetting". "It was just a f***ing bummer...I think it says so much about toxic masculinity," Schumer stated. Schumer, along with Regina Hall and Wanda Sykes, hosted the 94th Academy Awards. It was for the first time that three women hosted the Oscars.

356.title: Russian forces regrouping & preparing offensive in southeast: Ukraine
356.article_body: Russian forces are regrouping and preparing for an offensive in Ukraine's southeast, the Ukrainian military said. The military also said Russian forces aim "to establish full control over" two breakaway regions of Ukraine, which Russia has recognised as independent republics. Russian forces have retreated from northern Ukraine after Russia announced it would shift its focus from Kyiv.

357.title: US crypto billionaire-led FTX may invest in India's MPL: Report
357.article_body: US crypto billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried-led exchange FTX is in talks to invest in Bengaluru-based esports and mobile gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL), TechCrunch reported. MPL is looking to get the investment as an extension to its Series E funding at a valuation of $2.5 billion. Last year, MPL turned a unicorn with a $2.3 billion valuation.

358.title: 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese: Report
358.article_body: As many as 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese, as per a compendium by the Council for Social Development for 2019-20. Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district had the lowest percentage of women who were overweight or obese in the state in 2019-2020. The compendium has a comprehensive statistical picture of health and demographic status in Telangana.

359.title: Was easier to act with father than to have him as director: Shahid
359.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about working with father Pankaj Kapur in the film 'Jersey', said, "It was easier to act with him than to have him as a director." "It was much more relaxed. We used to get time to chill...have a cup of coffee together in between shots," Shahid added. Pankaj had directed Shahid in the 2011 film 'Mausam'.

360.title: Don't spit, disturb others: Pune Metro in etiquette manual for passengers
360.article_body: The Pune Metro has released a pamphlet named 'Metro Etiquettes' which has various directions for the passengers. "Spitting is a crime! It not only makes the place dirty but also can spread contagious diseases," the metro says in the pamphlet. It also asks passengers to keep the metro clean and not disturb other commuters with phone calls and music players.

361.title: Pune law student seeking education loan online cheated of ₹90,000
361.article_body: A 20-year-old Pune law student, seeking an education loan online, was cheated of ₹90,000, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters after calling on a number posted on a website. She was then asked to make multiple transfers in order to obtain a ₹5 lakh loan. A case has been registered under the IT Act, police added.

362.title: Ex-TCS staff turns part-time Zomato delivery agent, shares post on his challenges
362.article_body: A former TCS employee, Srinivasan Jayaraman's post on challenges he faced as a part-time Zomato delivery agent is being widely circulated. Jayaraman wrote about the inaccuracy of delivery locations of customers and restaurants. He said often phone numbers aren't properly updated and there were cases of long-distance delivery locations. "I salute those who choose this as a career," he said.

363.title: MP police team takes dip in Ganga with handcuffed man, served show-cause notice
363.article_body: A police team from Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur that had travelled to Uttar Pradesh to arrest a man allegedly took a holy dip in the river Ganga with the handcuffed accused. The officers were served a show-cause notice for dereliction of duty, an officer said. The team should have returned directly to the police station after arresting the accused, he added.

364.title: Govt employees asked to use bicycles for office on Wednesdays in Lakshadweep
364.article_body: The Lakshadweep administration has announced that it'll observe 'Cycle Day' every Wednesday from April 6 and all government employees will have to come to the office on bicycles to beat pollution. Employees with disability or any medical condition will be exempted from this rule, an official order said. Government officials have been asked to not use motor vehicles on Wednesdays.

365.title: Gurugram's max temp to touch 45°C by Sat; IMD issues heatwave alert
365.article_body: IMD has issued a yellow heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram and Faridabad, till April 7. Further, in its weekly forecast, IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 45°C by April 9. Gurugram on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 42.3°C, the highest maximum temperature recorded in the city so far this year.

366.title: Ignore, he needs to run his house too: Anupam on Ashish's 'Shark Tank' spoof
366.article_body: Shaadi.com's Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal responded to a fan who said they felt "very bad" about the way Mittal was portrayed in popular YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani's spoof of the show, titled 'Sasta Shaark Tank'. In an Instagram comment, Mittal wrote, "Ignore, use bhi apna ghar chalana hai (Ashish has to run his house too)."

367.title: Over 25,000 foreigners overstayed in India in 2021: Nityanand Rai
367.article_body: As many as 25,143 foreigners overstayed in the country after their visas expired in 2021, Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai told Parliament on Tuesday. "The overall number of overstaying foreigners from the period prior to 2019 and up to 31st December 2021 is 3,93,431," Rai said in a written reply.

368.title: After 'Kurup' & 'FIR', Vijay's 'Beast' gets banned in Kuwait: Report
368.article_body: Actor Vijay's film 'Beast' has reportedly been banned by the Ministry of Information in Kuwait. "Reason could be portrayal of Pakistan, terrorists or violence," film trade analyst Ramesh Bala tweeted. Recently, Dulquer Salmaan's 'Kurup' and Vishnu Vishal's 'FIR' were banned in Kuwait. "Kuwait [censorship] is becoming very strict in GCC compared to other countries in the region," Ramesh added.

369.title: US punishing 'disobedient' Imran Khan over Moscow visit: Russia
369.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Pakistan, the Russian Foreign Ministry issued a statement, accusing the US of intervening in the country's internal affairs. It said that the US decided to punish "disobedient" Imran Khan over his visit to Moscow. Khan met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on February 24, the day when Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine.

370.title: Krushna trolls Archana for not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show's US tour
370.article_body: Archana Puran Singh shared a video with comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek, where he teases her for not joining 'The Kapil Sharma' team on their US tour. "Archana ji ko nahi le ke jaa rahe." (We aren't taking Archana ji). Reacting to it, Archana jokingly said they aren't taking her to save money. She captioned the video, "Behind the scenes masti (fun)."

371.title: Denmark expels 15 Russian diplomats over security concerns
371.article_body: Denmark on Tuesday expelled 15 Russian 'intelligence officers' it said were serving as diplomats. "We will not accept...Russian intelligence officers...spying on Danish soil," Danish Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod said. Notably, the move comes amid reports of atrocities by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha, following which, Italy, Germany and France announced expulsion of several Russian diplomats.

372.title: Making coffee easier than bowling in powerplay in India: RCB's Willey
372.article_body: Asked to choose between making coffee and bowling in the powerplay in India, RCB all-rounder David Willey said the former is easier. Willey, who was bought by the Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹2 crore, registered bowling figures of 3-0-28-0 and 2-0-7-0 in his side's two matches so far in IPL 2022. RCB will face RR today at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

373.title: European Commission Prez to visit Kyiv this week to meet Zelenskyy
373.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will travel to Kyiv this week for a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, an European Union (EU) spokesman tweeted on Tuesday. She will be accompanied by EU's top diplomat Josep Borrell on the trip. European Parliament President Roberta Metsola had visited Kyiv last week.

374.title: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
374.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.

375.title: Will hold such events across Maha: Aaditya at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave
375.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray, while speaking at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave, on Tuesday said more such events will be held across the state. "The green industry is going to take a huge jump and we can lead the world in that. Creating revenue for our country and jobs for people," Thackeray said at the conclave.

376.title: TN Cong leader, who said Rahul & Priyanka should step aside, sacked
376.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress spokesperson Americai V Narayanan, who said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi should step aside to save Congress, has been sacked, reports said on Tuesday. "I love Rahul Gandhi but unfortunately, he has not delivered," he said. He also urged Congress to bring back former leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Jagan Mohan Reddy, Sharad Pawar and K Chandrashekar Rao.

377.title: RRR writer Vijayendra says film will have possible sequel: Sreenivasa
377.article_body: Telugu film producer Sreenivasa Kumar, who attended the success party of 'RRR', took to Twitter and said the 'RRR' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has hinted at the film's sequel. "'RRR' will be a franchise and possible sequel says writer Vijayendra," Sreenivasa tweeted. The success party, attended by Jr NTR and Ram Charan, was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish.

378.title: Rohit has been a fun captain in IPL: MI all-rounder Tim David
378.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, MI all-rounder Tim David said he's been a fun captain in IPL 2022. "I've only played two games with him, so just getting used to playing with him. Getting used to playing with lots of guys in the team, but we'll find our feet," he added. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

379.title: 2 men steal 15 Llyod ACs from Ahmedabad godown, arrested
379.article_body: Two men have been arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) for stealing 15 air conditioners from a factory godown in Naroda. Police said that the accused Sabyasachi Pal and Mehul More, both 20-years-old, were arrested with a rickshaw that had the air conditioners that they had stolen in November last year.

380.title: MP CM launches scheme to give loans up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment
380.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday launched the 'Udyam Kranti Yojana' in order to facilitate self-employment for the youth. Under the scheme, a loan guarantee of ₹1 lakh to ₹50 lakh will be provided with subsidies on interest rate for self-employment. Around one lakh youth are expected to benefit from the scheme in the financial year 2022-23.

381.title: Fuel price hike in India is 1/10th of price hike in other countries: HS Puri
381.article_body: Fuel prices hike in India is one-tenth of the price hike in other countries, Petroleum Minister HS Puri said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Comparing gasoline (petrol) prices between April 2021 and March 22, the prices in the US have increased by 51%, Canada 52%, Germany 55%, UK 55%, France 50%, Spain 58% but in India 5%," said Puri.

382.title: 2 held for threatening gay man with his sex video in Coimbatore
382.article_body: Two private college students were arrested for allegedly extorting money from a man by making him involved in a homosexual act and recording it in Coimbatore. According to the police, the accused, aged 19 and 22, had snatched a mobile phone and cash from the complainant. They also threatened to circulate the sex video if the complainant approached the police.

383.title: Wasn't allowed to put lipstick, thought life will be set on becoming actor: Rupali
383.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that her mother was strict and did not allow the actress to wear lipstick. She added that wearing lipstick was a big deal for her and she thought her life would be set if she became an actor. She added that she thought the director and other crew members worked hard and actors have it easy.

384.title: Bharti documents her baby's birth journey, fan says 'You're a strong woman'
384.article_body: Comedienne-host Bharti Singh and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, who welcomed their son on Sunday, shared a video on their YouTube channel LOL (Life of Limbachiyaa's). In the video, Bharti documented her baby's entire birth journey starting from when they went to the doctor to the last day of Bharti's pregnancy. Reacting to it, a user commented, "You're a strong woman."

385.title: Shot for a difficult climax right after my cancer treatment: Sanjay on KGF 2
385.article_body: Ahead of the release of 'KGF 2', actor Sanjay Dutt spoke about the "difficult climax" he shot right after his cancer treatment. "The climax had to be mounted on a large scale. It was a difficult climax, there was mud, dust, fire and a lot of action," Sanjay said. He added that the makers did everything to make him comfortable.

386.title: India has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population at present: Govt
386.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said India, at present, has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population with 33.41 lakh registered nursing personnel. He added that the country's doctor-population ratio is 1:834 with 13.01 lakh allopathic doctors and 5.65 lakh AYUSH doctors. Undergraduate seats in medical colleges have increased from 51,348 before 2014 to 89,875 in 2022, he added.

387.title: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles arrive at 2 major nesting sites in Odisha
387.article_body: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles have arrived at two major mass nesting sites in Odisha this year. According to officials, a record of over 5.5 lakh turtles congregated at Rushikulya estuary, whereas around five lakh turtles arrived at Gahirmatha Marine Sanctuary in Kendrapara. "We can't say why more turtles preferred Rushikulya rookery. It's a natural phenomenon," an official said.

388.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 makes up 72% of COVID cases in US: CDC
388.article_body: Omicron BA.2 sub-variant now makes up 72.2% of the COVID cases in the US, up from nearly 57.3% in the past week, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. However, the overall COVID-19 infections in America have dropped sharply after hitting record levels in January. According to WHO, BA.2 now makes up about 86% of all cases globally.

389.title: Delhi govt's step-motherly behaviour hinders working of 3 MCDs: Shah
389.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that the Delhi government's "step-motherly behaviour" hinders the efficient working of all three municipal corporations. "If state governments behave in a step-motherly fashion with civic bodies, neither Panchayati Raj nor urban local bodies will be successful," Shah added. He was speaking in Rajya Sabha on the Bill to merge the civic bodies.

390.title: Kashmir Files crosses ₹300 cr at worldwide box office, director shares post
390.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has earned ₹331 crore at the worldwide box office. He took to Twitter on Monday to share the news and wrote, "Thanks to all Indians all over the world in helping #TheKashmirFiles tell the truth to the world." It stars Mithun Chakraborty, Pallavi Joshi and Anupam Kher among others in pivotal roles.

391.title: Nobody pushing Pant to get ton in ODIs; 40s, 50s are fine: Rathour
391.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour said nobody is pushing Rishabh Pant to get a century in ODIs, terming it as fine if he can consistently score 40s, 50s. "Nobody wants him not to play his shots, we just want him to be more selective in picking the bowlers," added Rathour. Pant is yet to score his maiden ODI ton.

392.title: Hope Williamson will play in the England Test series: NZ coach Gary Stead
392.article_body: New Zealand coach Gary Stead said he is hopeful of captain Kane Williamson featuring in the Test series against England in June but emphasises being "smart" while managing his workload. "He's (Williamson) dying to play cricket for New Zealand...but we can't burn him out...We have to be smart around those things," Stead said while referring to Williamson's recent elbow injury.

393.title: Hybrid security to be evolved at establishments where CISF is deployed: Govt
393.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that hybrid models of security will be evolved to provide security at establishments where the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is deployed. "There is no proposal under consideration to train and certify private security agencies across the country by CISF," MoS for Home Nityanand Rai said.

394.title: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
394.article_body: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.

395.title: After SRK & Sanjay, Notebook actor Zaheer Iqbal receives UAE's Golden Visa
395.article_body: Zaheer Iqbal, who was seen in Salman Khan-backed film 'Notebook', took to Instagram to announce that he has received the UAE's Golden Visa. The visa will stay valid for 10 years and will allow him to work and live in the country without a national sponsor. Actors who've been granted Golden Visa include Shah Rukh Khan, Sanjay Dutt and Mammootty.

396.title: I have seen bodies frozen due to being burned: Ram Charan on Russia-Ukraine war
396.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said he has seen bodies frozen due to being burned in videos sent by Rusty, who was his security-in-charge while shooting for 'RRR' in Ukraine. "The videos were dreadful. If you touch [the bodies] probably they will turn into ashes," added Ram. "Rusty burst out crying," stated Ram. "I keep texting him...to pep him up," said Ram.

397.title: Indian pair of Manika, Archana enter top 5 in TT world rankings
397.article_body: India's women's doubles pair of Manika Batra and Archana Girish Kamath have moved up to the fourth spot (women's doubles category) in the latest world rankings issued by the International Table Tennis Federation. The two places' jump in the world rankings is due to the duo's performance in the WTT Star Contender Doha 2022 where they won a bronze medal.

398.title: 99% of world’s population now breathes polluted air: WHO
398.article_body: Almost the entire global population is breathing polluted air, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Monday. The WHO data revealed that 99% of people in the world are inhaling unhealthy levels of fine particulate matter and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) that threaten their health. People living in low and middle-income countries have been suffering the highest exposures, the data stated.

399.title: Videos of Zakir Naik found in laptop of Gorakhnath temple attacker: Police
399.article_body: The UP Police's Anti-Terrorism Squad found videos of radical Muslim preacher Zakir Naik and violence in Syria in the laptop recovered from the 29-year-old man who attacked two policemen outside Gorakhnath temple on Sunday. The attack is a part of a "serious conspiracy" and could be termed a "terror incident" based on evidence collected so far, the police added.

400.title: Rachakonda Police seizes 46,500 litres of illegal diesel, arrests 6
400.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police shared that an illegal diesel mafia has been busted in the city. The post further said that police has arrested six persons and seized 46,500 litres of illegal diesel from their possession. Notably, the price of petrol has reached ₹118.59 per litre in Hyderabad, while that of diesel has reached ₹104.62 per litre.

401.title: Once wanted to make Rohit bhai happy, he abused me on the field: Ishan Kishan
401.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan revealed he once wanted to make captain Rohit Sharma happy by trying to make the ball old by rolling it on ground during a match in his first IPL season. "I rolled it...but there was dew...He took out his towel and abused me," Ishan said. "He later said, 'Don't take it personally...it's just match-to-match'," he added.

402.title: Won't get scared even if I'm shot: Raut as ED attaches his properties
402.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said he won't get scared even if he is shot or sent to jail. His reaction came after ED attached properties linked to him in connection to an alleged ₹1,034 land scam case. He claimed he doesn't even own one acre of land in Alibaug and purchased properties with his hard-earned money.
